trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services Overview and Common Scenarios
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services Overview and Common Scenarios

trans-unit.source: This topic gives an overview of Azure Media Services
trans-unit.target: This topic gives an overview of Azure Media Services

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services Overview and Common Scenarios
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services Overview and Common Scenarios

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services is an extensible cloud-based platform that enables developers to build scalable media management and delivery applications.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services is an extensible cloud-based platform that enables developers to build scalable media management and delivery applications.

trans-unit.source: Media Services is based on REST APIs that enable you to securely upload, store, encode and package video or audio content for both on-demand and live streaming delivery to various clients (for example, TV, PC, and mobile devices).
trans-unit.target: Media Services is based on REST APIs that enable you to securely upload, store, encode and package video or audio content for both on-demand and live streaming delivery to various clients (for example, TV, PC, and mobile devices).

trans-unit.source: You can build end-to-end workflows using entirely Media Services.
trans-unit.target: You can build end-to-end workflows using entirely Media Services.

trans-unit.source: You can also choose to use third-party components for some parts of your workflow.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose to use third-party components for some parts of your workflow.

trans-unit.source: For example, encode using a third-party encoder.
trans-unit.target: For example, encode using a third-party encoder.

trans-unit.source: Then, upload, protect, package, deliver using Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Then, upload, protect, package, deliver using Media Services.

trans-unit.source: The following poster depicts Azure Media Services workflows, from media creation through consumption.
trans-unit.target: The following poster depicts Azure Media Services workflows, from media creation through consumption.

trans-unit.source: You can download the poster from here: <link><linkText>Azure Media Services poster</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can download the poster from here: <link><linkText>Azure Media Services poster</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Overview</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Overview</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can choose to stream your content live or deliver content on demand.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to stream your content live or deliver content on demand.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows common scenarios for delivering your content <link><linkText>live</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>on demand</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows common scenarios for delivering your content <link><linkText>live</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>on demand</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The topic also links to other relevant topics.
trans-unit.target: The topic also links to other relevant topics.

trans-unit.source: To build Media Services solutions, you can use:
trans-unit.target: To build Media Services solutions, you can use:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Media Services REST API</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Media Services REST API</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: One of the available client SDKs: <link><linkText>Azure Media Services SDK for .NET</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Azure SDK for Java</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Azure Media Services for Node.js</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Azure PHP SDK</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: One of the available client SDKs: <link><linkText>Azure Media Services SDK for .NET</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Azure SDK for Java</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Azure Media Services for Node.js</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Azure PHP SDK</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Existing tools: <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Azure-Media-Services-Explorer</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Existing tools: <link><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Azure-Media-Services-Explorer</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To start using Azure Media Services, you should have the following:
trans-unit.target: To start using Azure Media Services, you should have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Use Azure Management Portal, .NET, or REST API to create Azure Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Management Portal, .NET, or REST API to create Azure Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Create Account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Create Account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Set up development environment.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Set up development environment.

trans-unit.source: Choose .NET or REST API for your development environment.
trans-unit.target: Choose .NET or REST API for your development environment.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Set up environment</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Set up environment</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Also, learn how to connect programmatically <link><linkText>Connect</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Also, learn how to connect programmatically <link><linkText>Connect</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: (Recommended) Allocate one or more scale units.
trans-unit.target: (Recommended) Allocate one or more scale units.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to allocate one or more scale units for applications in production environment.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to allocate one or more scale units for applications in production environment.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Managing streaming endpoints</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Managing streaming endpoints</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Concepts
trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Concepts</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Concepts</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Delivering Media on-Demand with Azure Media Services: common scenarios and tasks
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Delivering Media on-Demand with Azure Media Services: common scenarios and tasks

trans-unit.source: This section describes common scenarios and provides links to relevant topics.
trans-unit.target: This section describes common scenarios and provides links to relevant topics.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram shows the major parts of the Media Services platform that are involved in delivering content on demand.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram shows the major parts of the Media Services platform that are involved in delivering content on demand.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>VoD workflow</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>VoD workflow</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Protect content in storage and deliver streaming media in the clear (non-encrypted)
trans-unit.target: Protect content in storage and deliver streaming media in the clear (non-encrypted)

trans-unit.source: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.
trans-unit.target: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to apply storage encryption option to your asset in order to protect your content during upload and while at rest in storage.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to apply storage encryption option to your asset in order to protect your content during upload and while at rest in storage.

trans-unit.source: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set.
trans-unit.target: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to apply storage encryption option to the output asset in order to protect your content at rest.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to apply storage encryption option to the output asset in order to protect your content at rest.

trans-unit.source: Configure asset delivery policy (used by dynamic packaging).
trans-unit.target: Configure asset delivery policy (used by dynamic packaging).

trans-unit.source: If your asset is storage encrypted, you must configure asset delivery policy.
trans-unit.target: If your asset is storage encrypted, you must configure asset delivery policy.

trans-unit.source: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand locator.
trans-unit.target: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand locator.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream content.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream content.

trans-unit.source: Stream published content.
trans-unit.target: Stream published content.

trans-unit.source: Protect content in storage, deliver dynamically encrypted streaming media
trans-unit.target: Protect content in storage, deliver dynamically encrypted streaming media

trans-unit.source: To be able to use dynamic encryption, you must first get at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream encrypted content.
trans-unit.target: To be able to use dynamic encryption, you must first get at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream encrypted content.

trans-unit.source: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.
trans-unit.target: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.

trans-unit.source: Apply storage encryption option to the asset.
trans-unit.target: Apply storage encryption option to the asset.

trans-unit.source: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set.
trans-unit.target: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set.

trans-unit.source: Apply storage encryption option to the output asset.
trans-unit.target: Apply storage encryption option to the output asset.

trans-unit.source: Create encryption content key for the asset you want to be dynamically encrypted during playback.
trans-unit.target: Create encryption content key for the asset you want to be dynamically encrypted during playback.

trans-unit.source: Configure content key authorization policy.
trans-unit.target: Configure content key authorization policy.

trans-unit.source: Configure asset delivery policy (used by dynamic packaging and dynamic encryption).
trans-unit.target: Configure asset delivery policy (used by dynamic packaging and dynamic encryption).

trans-unit.source: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand locator.
trans-unit.target: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand locator.

trans-unit.source: Stream published content.
trans-unit.target: Stream published content.

trans-unit.source: Index content
trans-unit.target: Index content

trans-unit.source: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an Asset.
trans-unit.target: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an Asset.

trans-unit.source: Index content.
trans-unit.target: Index content.

trans-unit.source: The indexing job generates files that can be used as Closed Captions (CC) in video playback.
trans-unit.target: The indexing job generates files that can be used as Closed Captions (CC) in video playback.

trans-unit.source: It also generates files that enable you to do in-video search and jump to the exact location of the video.
trans-unit.target: It also generates files that enable you to do in-video search and jump to the exact location of the video.

trans-unit.source: Consume indexed content.
trans-unit.target: Consume indexed content.

trans-unit.source: Deliver progressive download
trans-unit.target: Deliver progressive download

trans-unit.source: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.
trans-unit.target: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.

trans-unit.source: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set or a single MP4.
trans-unit.target: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set or a single MP4.

trans-unit.source: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand or SAS locator.
trans-unit.target: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand or SAS locator.

trans-unit.source: If using OnDemand locator, make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you plan to progressively download content.
trans-unit.target: If using OnDemand locator, make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you plan to progressively download content.

trans-unit.source: If using SAS locator, the content is downloaded from the Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: If using SAS locator, the content is downloaded from the Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you do not need to have streaming reserved units.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you do not need to have streaming reserved units.

trans-unit.source: Progressively download content.
trans-unit.target: Progressively download content.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Delivering Live Streaming Events with Azure Media Services
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Delivering Live Streaming Events with Azure Media Services

trans-unit.source: When working with Live Streaming the following components are commonly involved:
trans-unit.target: When working with Live Streaming the following components are commonly involved:

trans-unit.source: A camera that is used to broadcast an event.
trans-unit.target: A camera that is used to broadcast an event.

trans-unit.source: A live video encoder that converts signals from the camera to streams that are sent to a live streaming service.
trans-unit.target: A live video encoder that converts signals from the camera to streams that are sent to a live streaming service.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, multiple live encoders.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, multiple live encoders.

trans-unit.source: For certain critical live events that demand very high availability and quality of experience, it is recommended to employ active-active redundant encoders to achieve seamless failover with no data loss.
trans-unit.target: For certain critical live events that demand very high availability and quality of experience, it is recommended to employ active-active redundant encoders to achieve seamless failover with no data loss.

trans-unit.source: A live streaming service that enables you to do the following:
trans-unit.target: A live streaming service that enables you to do the following:

trans-unit.source: ingest live content using various live streaming protocols (for example RTMP or Smooth Streaming),
trans-unit.target: ingest live content using various live streaming protocols (for example RTMP or Smooth Streaming),

trans-unit.source: encode your stream into adaptive bitrate stream
trans-unit.target: encode your stream into adaptive bitrate stream

trans-unit.source: preview your live stream,
trans-unit.target: preview your live stream,

trans-unit.source: store the ingested content in order to be streamed later (Video-on-Demand)
trans-unit.target: store the ingested content in order to be streamed later (Video-on-Demand)

trans-unit.source: deliver the content through common streaming protocols (for example, MPEG DASH, Smooth, HLS, HDS) directly to your customers, or to a Content Delivery Network (CDN) for further distribution.
trans-unit.target: deliver the content through common streaming protocols (for example, MPEG DASH, Smooth, HLS, HDS) directly to your customers, or to a Content Delivery Network (CDN) for further distribution.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services (AMS) provides the ability to ingest, encode, preview, store, and deliver your live streaming content.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services (AMS) provides the ability to ingest, encode, preview, store, and deliver your live streaming content.

trans-unit.source: When delivering your content to customers your goal is to deliver a high quality video to various devices under different network conditions.
trans-unit.target: When delivering your content to customers your goal is to deliver a high quality video to various devices under different network conditions.

trans-unit.source: To take care of quality and network conditions, use live encoders to encode your stream to multi-bitrate (adaptive bitrate) video stream.
trans-unit.target: To take care of quality and network conditions, use live encoders to encode your stream to multi-bitrate (adaptive bitrate) video stream.

trans-unit.source: To take care of streaming on different devices, use Media Services <link><linkText>dynamic packaging</linkText><title></title></link> to dynamically re-package your stream to different protocols.
trans-unit.target: To take care of streaming on different devices, use Media Services <link><linkText>dynamic packaging</linkText><title></title></link> to dynamically re-package your stream to different protocols.

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports delivery of the following adaptive bitrate streaming technologies: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports delivery of the following adaptive bitrate streaming technologies: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).

trans-unit.source: In Azure Media Services, Channels, Programs, and StreamingEndpoints handle all the live streaming functionalities including ingest, formatting, DVR, security, scalability and redundancy.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Media Services, Channels, Programs, and StreamingEndpoints handle all the live streaming functionalities including ingest, formatting, DVR, security, scalability and redundancy.

trans-unit.source: A Channel represents a pipeline for processing live streaming content.
trans-unit.target: A Channel represents a pipeline for processing live streaming content.

trans-unit.source: Currently, a Channel can receive a live input streams in the following way:
trans-unit.target: Currently, a Channel can receive a live input streams in the following way:

trans-unit.source: An on-premises live encoder sends a single-bitrate stream to the Channel that is enabled to perform live encoding with Media Services in one of the following formats: RTP (MPEG-TS), RTMP, or Smooth Streaming (Fragmented MP4).
trans-unit.target: An on-premises live encoder sends a single-bitrate stream to the Channel that is enabled to perform live encoding with Media Services in one of the following formats: RTP (MPEG-TS), RTMP, or Smooth Streaming (Fragmented MP4).

trans-unit.source: The Channel then performs live encoding of the incoming single bitrate stream to a multi-bitrate (adaptive) video stream.
trans-unit.target: The Channel then performs live encoding of the incoming single bitrate stream to a multi-bitrate (adaptive) video stream.

trans-unit.source: When requested, Media Services delivers the stream to customers.
trans-unit.target: When requested, Media Services delivers the stream to customers.

trans-unit.source: Encoding a live stream with Media Services is in Preview.
trans-unit.target: Encoding a live stream with Media Services is in Preview.

trans-unit.source: An on-premises live encoder sends a multi-bitrate RTMP or Smooth Streaming (Fragmented MP4) to the Channel.
trans-unit.target: An on-premises live encoder sends a multi-bitrate RTMP or Smooth Streaming (Fragmented MP4) to the Channel.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following live encoders that output multi-bitrate Smooth Streaming: Elemental, Envivio, Cisco.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following live encoders that output multi-bitrate Smooth Streaming: Elemental, Envivio, Cisco.

trans-unit.source: The following live encoders output RTMP: Adobe Flash Live, Telestream Wirecast, and Tricaster transcoders.
trans-unit.target: The following live encoders output RTMP: Adobe Flash Live, Telestream Wirecast, and Tricaster transcoders.

trans-unit.source: The ingested streams pass through Channels without any further processing.
trans-unit.target: The ingested streams pass through Channels without any further processing.

trans-unit.source: Your live encoder can also send a single bitrate stream to a channel that is not enabled for live encoding, but that is not recommended.
trans-unit.target: Your live encoder can also send a single bitrate stream to a channel that is not enabled for live encoding, but that is not recommended.

trans-unit.source: When requested, Media Services delivers the stream to customers.
trans-unit.target: When requested, Media Services delivers the stream to customers.

trans-unit.source: Working with Channels that are enabled to perform live encoding with Azure Media Services
trans-unit.target: Working with Channels that are enabled to perform live encoding with Azure Media Services

trans-unit.target: The following diagram shows the major parts of the AMS platform that are involved in Live Streaming workflow where a Channel is enabled to perform live encoding with Media Services.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Live workflow</linkText>

trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Working with Channels that are Enabled to Perform Live Encoding with Azure Media Services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.target: The following diagram shows the major parts of the AMS platform that are involved in this Live Streaming workflow.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Live workflow</linkText>

trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Working with Channels that Receive Multi-bitrate Live Stream from On-premises Encoders

trans-unit.source: Consuming content
trans-unit.target: Consuming content

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services provides the tools you need to create rich, dynamic client player applications for most platforms including: iOS Devices, Android Devices, Windows, Windows Phone, Xbox, and Set-top boxes.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services provides the tools you need to create rich, dynamic client player applications for most platforms including: iOS Devices, Android Devices, Windows, Windows Phone, Xbox, and Set-top boxes.

trans-unit.source: The following topic provides links to SDKs and Player Frameworks that you can use to develop your own client applications that can consume streaming media from Media Services.
trans-unit.target: The following topic provides links to SDKs and Player Frameworks that you can use to develop your own client applications that can consume streaming media from Media Services.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Developing Video Player Applications</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Developing Video Player Applications</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Enabling Azure CDN
trans-unit.target: Enabling Azure CDN

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports integration with Azure CDN.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports integration with Azure CDN.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to enable Azure CDN, see <link><linkText>How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on how to enable Azure CDN, see <link><linkText>How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Scaling a Media Services account
trans-unit.target: Scaling a Media Services account

trans-unit.source: You can scale Media Services by specifying the number of Streaming Reserved Units and Encoding Reserved Units that you would like your account to be provisioned with.
trans-unit.target: You can scale Media Services by specifying the number of Streaming Reserved Units and Encoding Reserved Units that you would like your account to be provisioned with.

trans-unit.source: You can also scale your Media Services account by adding storage accounts to it.
trans-unit.target: You can also scale your Media Services account by adding storage accounts to it.

trans-unit.source: Each storage account is limited to 500 TB.
trans-unit.target: Each storage account is limited to 500 TB.

trans-unit.source: To expand your storage beyond the default limitations, you can choose to attach multiple storage accounts to a single Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: To expand your storage beyond the default limitations, you can choose to attach multiple storage accounts to a single Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Service Level Agreement (SLA)
trans-unit.target: Service Level Agreement (SLA)

trans-unit.source: For Media Services Encoding, we guarantee 99.9% availability of REST API transactions.
trans-unit.target: For Media Services Encoding, we guarantee 99.9% availability of REST API transactions.

trans-unit.source: For Streaming, we will successfully service requests with a 99.9% availability guarantee for existing media content when at least one Streaming Unit is purchased.
trans-unit.target: For Streaming, we will successfully service requests with a 99.9% availability guarantee for existing media content when at least one Streaming Unit is purchased.

trans-unit.source: For Live Channels, we guarantee that running Channels will have external connectivity at least 99.9% of the time.
trans-unit.target: For Live Channels, we guarantee that running Channels will have external connectivity at least 99.9% of the time.

trans-unit.source: For Content Protection, we guarantee that we will successfully fulfill key requests at least 99.9% of the time.
trans-unit.target: For Content Protection, we guarantee that we will successfully fulfill key requests at least 99.9% of the time.

trans-unit.source: For Indexer, we will successfully service Indexer Task requests processed with an Encoding Reserved Unit 99.9% of the time.
trans-unit.target: For Indexer, we will successfully service Indexer Task requests processed with an Encoding Reserved Unit 99.9% of the time.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure SLA</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure SLA</linkText><title></title></link>.
